words.definition: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
words.example: She was meticulous in her work, ensuring every detail was perfect.

words.definition: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
words.example: He was the quintessential gentleman, polite and gracious to everyone he met.

words.definition: present, appearing, or found everywhere.
words.example: Smartphones are ubiquitous these days, with almost everyone using one.

words.definition: A gentle wind or current of air.
words.example: The breeze rustled the leaves on the trees.

words.definition: The time of day immediately following sunset.
words.example: The sky turned shades of orange and purple during dusk.

words.definition: Great joy, amusement, or happiness.
words.example: Their laughter filled the room with mirth.

words.definition: The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
words.example: Finding a hundred-dollar bill on the ground was pure serendipity.

words.definition: Lasting for a very short time.
words.example: The beauty of the sunset was ephemeral, gone within moments.

words.definition: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
words.example: She is the quintessential romantic heroine.

words.definition: Accept something reluctantly but without protest.
words.example: She seemed to acquiesce to the decision, albeit unwillingly.

words.definition: A mode of behavior or way of thought peculiar to an individual.
words.example: One of his idiosyncrasies is always wearing mismatched socks.

words.definition: Displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion or effort; slow and relaxed.
words.example: On a hot summer day, the cat lay languid in the shade.

words.definition: Denoting a period of time in the past that was idyllically happy and peaceful.
words.example: She recalled the halcyon days of her youth with fondness.

words.definition: The partially shaded outer region of the shadow cast by an opaque object.
words.example: The moon's penumbra caused a subtle eclipse, noticeable to those who knew where to look.

words.definition: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.
words.example: The CEO was surrounded by sycophants who agreed with every word he said.

words.definition: The appearance of being true or real.
words.example: The novel's attention to detail gave it a sense of verisimilitude.

words.definition: Something short-lived or transient.
words.example: The mayfly is an ephemeron, with a lifespan of just a single day.

words.definition: Exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
words.example: His quixotic plan to build a city on the moon was met with skepticism.

words.definition: Reserved, modest, and shy.
words.example: She gave a demure smile in response to the compliment.

words.definition: A solution or remedy for all difficulties or diseases.
words.example: The new policy was not a panacea for the economy's problems.

words.definition: Something very light, thin, and insubstantial or delicate.
words.example: A gossamer veil of mist hung over the landscape.

words.definition: A soft gentle breeze.
words.example: The zephyr made the day feel cooler than it actually was.

words.definition: A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically an unwelcome one.
words.example: The snowstorm in April was an aberration for the region's climate.

words.definition: Think deeply about something; meditate or reflect.
words.example: He would often cogitate on the mysteries of the universe.

words.definition: Vivacious and enthusiastic.
words.example: Her effervescent personality made her the life of the party.

words.definition: Wicked or criminal.
words.example: The villain's nefarious plan was thwarted by the superheroes.

words.definition: Beauty.
words.example: The pulchritude of the sunset left them in awe.

words.definition: Characteristic of or resembling a seraph or seraphim; angelic.
words.example: The choir's seraphic harmony filled the cathedral.

words.definition: To make something better or more tolerable.
words.example: The new law is expected to ameliorate the lives of low-income families.

words.definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
words.example: The capricious weather made it difficult to plan outdoor activities.

words.definition: Lacking a plan, purpose, or enthusiasm.
words.example: The meeting was desultory and unproductive.

words.definition: To cause someone to feel drained of energy or vitality; weaken.
words.example: The intense heat can enervate even the most energetic individuals.

words.definition: Intense happiness.
words.example: Her felicity was evident when she received the good news.

words.definition: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
words.example: The garrulous host kept the guests entertained with endless stories.

words.definition: Not conforming with accepted or orthodox standards or beliefs.
words.example: His heterodox views often caused debates within the academic community.

words.definition: Persisting tirelessly.
words.example: The indefatigable worker continued well into the night.

words.definition: To place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
words.example: The exhibition juxtaposes modern art with classical pieces.

words.definition: Having complex patterns of colors; multicolored.
words.example: The kaleidoscopic display at the festival was mesmerizing.

words.definition: Expressed clearly; easy to understand.
words.example: The professor's explanation was lucid and helped everyone grasp the concept.

words.definition: Render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible.
words.example: The technical jargon in the report served to obfuscate the main points.

words.definition: Put an end to (a rebellion or other disorder), typically by the use of force.
words.example: The uprising was quickly quelled by the government forces.

words.definition: Attractive and impressive through being richly colorful or sumptuous.
words.example: The ballroom was resplendent with lights and decorations.

words.definition: (of a person) reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little.
words.example: The taciturn man spoke only when necessary.

words.definition: Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
words.example: Smartphones are ubiquitous these days, with almost everyone using one.

words.definition: Regard with great respect; revere.
words.example: Many cultures venerate their ancestors, often with elaborate ceremonies.

words.definition: Having or showing a feeling of vague or regretful longing.
words.example: She gave a wistful smile as she reminisced about her childhood.

words.definition: An individual who is attracted to foreign peoples, cultures, or customs.
words.example: As a xenophile, he enjoyed traveling and experiencing different cultures.

words.definition: A wooden crosspiece that is fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to the plow or cart that they are to pull.
words.example: The farmer used a yoke to harness the oxen to the cart.

words.definition: A person who is fanatical and uncompromising in pursuit of their religious, political, or other ideals.
words.example: The zealot was willing to do anything for his cause.

words.definition: The indefinite continued progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future regarded as a whole.
words.example: He wondered where the time had gone.

words.definition: A human being regarded as an individual.
words.example: She is a person of considerable influence.

words.definition: The time taken by a planet to make one revolution around the sun.
words.example: The year 2024 has been eventful.

words.definition: A method, style, or manner of doing something.
words.example: There are two ways to solve this problem.

words.definition: A period of 24 hours, especially from twelve o'clock one night to twelve o'clock the next night.
words.example: The conference lasts for three days.

words.definition: An object that one need not, cannot, or does not wish to give a specific name to.
words.example: Look at that strange thing over there.

words.definition: An adult human male.
words.example: He is a man of his word.

words.definition: The earth, together with all of its countries, peoples, and natural features.
words.example: She wants to travel the world.

words.definition: A young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority.
words.example: The park was full of children playing.

words.definition: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms.
words.example: Please bring me a glass of water.
